name: Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking and Programming Lab
references: Kenneth Lambert, Fundamentals of Python: First Programs, Cengage Learning,
R.G. Dromey, how to solve it by Computer, Pearson, 2008.
experiments: Familiarization with Python installation, basic syntax and running scripts in the shell.
Programs on iterative constructs. (While, do-while, for).
Programs using user defined functions and in-built function calls.
Programs involving in-built data structures like List, Tuples and Dictionaries.
Programs related to Files and I/O.
Programs that require sorting, searching and selection as sub-routines.
Implementation of a capstone application to unify the concepts learnt in the course.
